items.description: River Cole and Dorcan Brook
items.message: This Flood Alert has been removed. The risk of flooding has now passed. Further heavy rain showers are possible this afternoon (06/08/2023) but we do not expect them to significantly raise river levels. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.

items.description: River Gowy catchment including areas around Frodsham

floodArea.county: Cheshire East, Cheshire West and Chester, Halton

items.message:
River levels have risen at the Bridge Trafford river gauge as a result of this morning’s rainfall.  We believe there is a possibility of flooding for low lying land and roads around the River Milton and Hornsmill/Hool, Stanney Mill and Thornton Brooks and their tributaries from now until 20:00 today 06/08/23, and river levels are expected to peak to 1.63m around 16:00.

Our incident response staff are closely monitoring weather forecasts and river levels and will issue further flood warnings if necessary.

Please be aware of your surroundings and keep up to date with the current situation.

This message will be as the situation changes.

items.description: River Rye catchment
items.message: River levels have fallen below levels of concern following yesterday’s 05/08/23 rainfall. However levels will remain high through the day and we are expecting some rain showers this afternoon, which could lead to small rises in river levels again. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.

items.message:
The flood forecast has changed significantly. As a result, there is no longer a risk of flooding in the area.

The risk of flooding from Storm Antoni has now reduced.

The forecast includes some light rainfall for the next few days.

We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.

items.description: Somerset coast at Porlock Weir
Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message:
River levels are expected to be high as a result of spring tides.

The forecast high tide at Richmond is 4.60mAOD at 18:45 on 06/08/23.

Flooding of low-lying roads and footpaths is expected, which may exist for one to two hours either side of high tide. Flooding of properties is not expected.

We believe there is a possibility of flooding for Putney Embankment (SW15), Chiswick Mall and Strand on the Green (W4), Thames Bank at Mortlake (SW14), Ranelagh Drive (TW1), Friars Lane and Water Lane (TW9), Riverside and The Embankment at Twickenham, and the Towpath below Teddington Lock. 

Astronomical tide levels are falling. The river flow at Teddington Weir is low for this time of year at 35 cubic metres per second and is steady. We anticipate the flows to remain low for the next 3 days.

We are closely monitoring the situation.

This message will be updated by 10:30 on 07/08/23, or as the situation changes.

items.description: North Sea coast at Withernsea, Easington and Kilnsea
items.message: Weather and tide conditions along the coast have improved. As a result, there is no longer a risk of flooding in the area. The peak spring tides have passed so we are not expecting any further impacts over the next few days. We will continue to monitor the forecast and may re-issue this alert if conditions deteriorate. Continue to be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.

items.description: Hunstanton coast in Norfolk
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed. 

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 

Coastal conditions should ease for the 06/08/2023 high tide at 23:00 hours.

items.description: The Essex coast at Coalhouse Fort
items.message: Tide levels are now below the flood risk threshold. The forecast shows no further flood risk from high tides today. There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We will continue to monitor levels closely and issue further Flood Alerts if necessary.

items.description: Upper River Derwent

floodArea.county: East Riding of Yorkshire, North Yorkshire
floodArea.riverOrSea: River Derwent, Sea Cut, River Hertford, Burniston Beck

items.message: River levels remain high on the River Derwent due to heavy rainfall on Saturday 05/08/2023. Areas most at risk include low lying land, roads and footpaths in the Upper Derwent around Low Marishes. Levels remain high into Monday. Drier weather is expected later this week where levels should start to fall. We will continue to monitor the forecast. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 09:00 on 07/08/2023, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Silk Stream and the Deans, Edgware, Dollis, Mutton and Wealdstone Brooks
items.message:
The flood forecast has changed significantly. As a result, there is no longer a risk of flooding in the area.

The risk of flooding from Storm Antoni has now reduced.

The forecast includes some light rainfall for the next few days.

We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.

We are continuing to deploy pumps, people and equipment, and liaising with emergency services and local authorities in the Tokyngton area on the Wembley Brook.
